pages.text: Arborispongia comes from the lower Carboniferous, with fossils found the in Bear Gulch Limestone, Montana (USA). It is an branching tree-like demosponge, growing up to around 20 cm in size. It is amongst the most common sponges found within the Bear Gulch, so much so it became the foundation for reef-like ecosystems around the area.
